alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; Morrison (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:19PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Recent rain on top of a melting snowpack has increased river levels. The resultant runoff combined with water already routing through the headwaters will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fort Ripley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Flooding of low lying areas adjacent the river is expected At 12.0 feet, The boat landing and parking lot at the public access are under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Monday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.1 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 05/16/1999. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Mississippi River Fort Ripley 10.5 11.9 Mon 10 am CD 12.0 12.1 12.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
